info.title: Events from SAP S/4HANA
info.description: This is an event type catalog from an event provider of type SAP S/4HANA

message.description: The event is raised when a freight order is created.
The event is raised when a freight order is created.

sap_s4_beh_FreightOrder_Created_v1.name: sap.s4.beh.FreightOrder.Created.v1
sap_s4_beh_FreightOrder_Created_v1.description: The event is raised when a freight order is created.

sap_s4_beh_FreightOrder_Created_v1.name: sap.s4.beh.FreightOrder.Created.v1
sap_s4_beh_FreightOrder_Created_v1.description: The event is raised when a freight order is created.

TransportationMode.description:
# Definition

Specifies how a product is transported, for example, by road, rail, sea, or air.

# Example

TransportationOrderType.description:
# Definition

Indicates one of the following types:
 - Freight order type
 - Freight booking type
 - Freight unit type

# Example

TransportationShippingType.description:
# Definition

Specifies how the transportation of cargo is planned and executed.

# Use

Road freight orders are created with shipping type ***FTL (Full Truck Load)*** and rail freight orders with ***Carload***.

For ocean freight bookings, you can select one of the following shipping types:
 - ***LCL (Less Than Container Load)***
 - ***FCL (Full Container Load)***

Air freight bookings are created with shipping type ***Loose***.

# Example

Specifies how the transportation of cargo is planned and executed.

# Use

Road freight orders are created with shipping type ***FTL (Full Truck Load)*** and rail freight orders with ***Carload***.

For ocean freight bookings, you can select one of the following shipping types:
 - ***LCL (Less Than Container Load)***
 - ***FCL (Full Container Load)***

Air freight bookings are created with shipping type ***Loose***.

# Example

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.
